Process execution originating from clipb.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4688 (Process Creation). Identify instances where command/scripting interpreter processes (cmd.exe, powershell.exe, etc.) are created with unusual or obfuscated command-line arguments, especially if the parent process is a browser or email client. Apply entropy analysis to command line arguments to detect obfuscation. Use correlation analysis to link process creation events with preceding browser or email client activity.

Monitor Windows Event ID 4688 (Process Creation). Identify instances where explorer.exe launches processes with command-line arguments that deviate significantly from normal user-initiated launches (i.e., indicating execution via the Run dialog). Analyze command line arguments for suspicious patterns or known malicious commands. Use frequency analysis to identify rare command executions via explorer.exe.
